timeline.author: KurtYoung

timeline.bodyText: how about using the target table name as the column name?
timeline.author: KurtYoung

replies.bodyText: I think "affected_rowcount" is necessary, how about "affected_rowcount_sink_table_name" ?
replies.author: godfreyhe

replies.bodyText: Seems too long to me, I think most users are aware of this bigint is representing the row count inserted into the table
replies.author: KurtYoung

replies.bodyText: in fact, the table qualified name may be long. in addition, we may need to add catalog name and database name to distinguish between tables with the same name.
replies.author: godfreyhe

replies.bodyText: Yes, that will be long. But if we don't show this, after we display some real row counts in the future, it would be impossible for users to understand the meaning.
replies.author: KurtYoung

replies.bodyText:
yes, if there are many sinks.
I will try to extract sink identifier names as the shortest form (also make sure them are unique) to reduce the length of field name
replies.author: godfreyhe

timeline.bodyText: I would prefer to keep it simple for now, just use the full identify is enough.
timeline.author: KurtYoung
